meanings.definition: Capable of being presumed or assumed.
meanings.sent1: It is presumable that the sun will rise tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: The presumable outcome of the experiment was predicted by the scientists.
meanings.sent3: The presumable culprit turned out to be a mischievous squirrel.
meanings.sent4: Her presumable innocence shone through her clear eyes.
meanings.sent5: The presumable answer to the riddle was hidden in plain sight.

meanings.definition: Likely to be true or correct.
meanings.sent1: The presumable winner of the race crossed the finish line first.
meanings.sent2: His presumable excuse for being late was traffic.
meanings.sent3: The presumable hero of the story turned out to be a tiny mouse.
meanings.sent4: The presumable solution to the problem was simpler than expected.
meanings.sent5: The presumable cause of the fire was faulty wiring.

meanings.definition: Able to be inferred or deduced.
meanings.sent1: The presumable meaning of the ancient text was deciphered by the archaeologist.
meanings.sent2: Her presumable age was estimated to be around 30 years old.
meanings.sent3: The presumable location of the treasure was marked on an old map.
meanings.sent4: The presumable outcome of the negotiation was a compromise.
meanings.sent5: The presumable source of the leak was a cracked pipe.
